content: ""We have agreed to support a general SDR allocation which will inject $250bn (£170bn) into the world economy and increase global liquidity," it said. SDRs are Special Drawing Rights, a synthetic paper currency issued by the International Monetary Fund that has lain dormant for half a century. " }In effect, the G20 leaders have activated the IMF's power to create money and begin global "quantitative easing". In doing so, they are putting a de facto world currency into play. It is outside the control of any sovereign body. Conspiracy theorists will love it. " I have felt this was the agenda all along for many years and now it seems to coming to past. Anti-Protectionism policies disavows our Sovereignty as an independent nation that will cause us to end up being just another follower to the New World Order.

title: The G20 moves the world a step closer to a global currency

content: The "world currency" would simply act as a universal reserve currency that would be immune to the problems the world is experiencing now. That's basically what an SDR is, if you read the article. Use of SDRs would not eliminate the use of national currencies by the citizenry.
reply: The "world currency" would simply act as a universal reserve currency that would be immune to the problems the world is experiencing now. That's basically what an SDR is, if you read the article. Use of SDRs would not eliminate the use of national currencies by the citizenry.

title: The G20 moves the world a step closer to a global currency

content: I am 120% for this new currency. Get rid of the green back. What a wasted currency. Always has been. I'd like to see a currency of different sizes or shapes and different colors. At least blind people could tell if you were trying to pass off a $10.00 bill for a $20.00 bill.
